author: Ademil Correia

author: Kelvin Daigle
text: 'I stay in St. Louis Missouri I’ve always wanted to try cakes from this location so once I found out that DoorDash was delivering the slices of cake I decided to order five of the slices of cake but upon delivery two of the cakes were not correct and one was missing  and the cakes tasted as if they have been refrigerated for a few days I contacted DoorDash and they said they could not replace the items and they can’t  refund it so I was really disappointed in my first experience with this product I’ve always thought it would be better than what it was but I guess you always have to try something once to get a full experience and I wasn’t satisfied with my experience I thought it would be better than what it was but the Cakes taste  basic'

author: Tea Tree
text: "Carlo's Bakery has cake slice vending machines in Vegas and other cities. It gave me the wrong cake
column5: which had ingredients I'm allergic to. Each slice costs $10.00. I called and emailed customer service for a refund. A month later
column6: never heard back from anyone. Zero stars for zero customer service!!!!"

author: Jose Ramos
text: 'Always good pastry
column5: good prices'

author: Steve Kerr
text:
'"What to Say" 👨‍🍳Traditional Italian Bakery "Delicious" O.M.G 🇮🇹 This is Italian 🇮🇹
Lobster Claw Pastries O.M.G
Rum Cakes O.M.G.
🇮🇹 Italian birthday cakes loaded with rum and almonds around the side of the cake and let's not forget Whip Cream..
(No Cream of Tarter)  stiffening whipped cream.  (Straight up Whip Cream) O.M.G
You New York Residents of Hoboken NJ.
Try The Cake 🎂 Boss Italian Birthday Cake
Been going to this Bakery  long long time when his Father was running the Bakery.
I 'm 66. His Father Started a Small Bakery  on Adam Street in Hoboken my Dad would take me into his father's Bakery when a was a young boy.. The Cake Boss Father eventually close the small bakery and opened this Bakery on Washington Street Hoboken. The father died and his son took over
The Cake Boss took over and thats how the Cake Boss name was born! God Bless Buddy.. Great!  Great! Family owned  Bakery
🇮🇹 👨‍🍳 🇮🇹 This is Italian! Hey Buddy! Hey Cake Boss ! Don't Americanized this Bakery keep that Italian taste...again God Bless!'

text: "What kind of deseption!!! I just drove 4hr straight from Maryland to visit that place and get a lobster tail. It almost make me run  from that place. in 2nd I was still excited for try my dessert and can’t be more disappointed instead to be fresh and crunchy the lobster tail was soooo chewy and absolutely Not fresh. Of course I got I few other dessert which was just Ok and as you can imagine after 4hr drive I was need to use the restroom wich I was denied to use even after spend (waste ) my money at that place"

author: Ryan Murphy
text: 'I
column5: like a lot of others
column6: was really excited to visit the original Carlo’s when I was in the area. I had been to the location in Dallas and I was disappointed in the quality and the selection
column7: but I thought surely the original would be better. When I got there
column8: it had the same overly commercialized feel as I remember at the Dallas location. It was over priced. I paid nearly $30 for 4 cannolis and 2 lobster tails. They were pre-boxed. A voice in the back of my head told me I would be disappointed again
column9: but I bought them anyway. When I got them home to Los Angeles later that same day
column10: the cannolis were soggy and had a strange taste and the lobster tails had a tough
column11: ropy texture that was hard to chew. The filling also had a weird taste. So
column12: I echo other reviews that say that quality seems to not be what you’d expect. I was disappointed. I had walked by another “ma and pa” bakery on the same street that in retrospect

author: Coralyn Gash
text: "Having watched the Cake Boss
column5: I really wanted to order a special cake to celebrate my mother's 90th birthday.  I sent a message through their special orders department.  I heard nothing.  I sent a second message 3 days later and finally got a response.  They wanted to make sure I was willing to pick up (I was) and asked for the details of the order (number of people
column6: design ideas
column7: etc.).  I immediately sent a response
column8: answering all the questions and letting them know the date of my mother's 90 birthday (October 2) and that I really wanted to make the day special.  I gave them a reference number from the cakes on their site
column10: said that I wanted it two tiers and the type of decorations.  After waiting for 5 days for ANY acknowledgement
column11: I sent them another email.  Still no response.\n\nThis is my mother's 90th birthday.  During the last year of Covid deaths
column12: we have lost so many of our elderly and I wanted to make this event special.  Buddy and his team can't even be bothered responding.  Needless to say
column13: I ordered her cake from a bakery that does respond."

author: Laura Lightfoot
text: "I ordered my cake. My daughter wanted a rainbow cake for her birthday that I was unable to bake for her this year due to moving into a new home. The cake was pretty but extremely small. It arrived on time but even after letting it thaw three hours
column5: it was still frozen so we ate it the next day. Working in a famous bakery in the past
column6: I've come to expect much higher quality of cake than what I received. The cake was made with American buttercreme which was extremely disappointing. I was expecting Swiss or Italian buttercreme which is much better quality. There was so much of the American buttercreme icing it was sickening and no one got through the cake slices presented to them. Will not be ordering from them again. You can find much better cake out there for less made with higher quality ingredients. When a bakery uses American buttercreme
column7: it shows that they are merely trying to make a quick buck
column8: sacrificing quality in the process. Not worth the money. The two stars are only because it was able to be shipped
column9: arrived on time and was pretty."

Known as their patriotic cake

author: Lynn C
text: "The original Carlo's Bake Shop.  Was bummed none of Buddy's family members were in the store but we have never seen him or his family in the Times Square store.  We got a slice of rainbow cake and a lobster tail.  The cake was delicious but frosting is very sweet.  The cake decorations are amazing on the cakes sold in the shop.  The store looks like the one in Times Square except the original exterior.  A worker in the store told me this location was remodeled after shop damage caused by Hurricane Sandy.  I love Buddys family picture in the store."

text: 'used to go all the time when the show first aired. It was like any mom and pop bakery in Jersey
column5: but was still very good since everything was made fresh there with many options. We used to get the vanilla and chocolate fondant cakes for all our birthdays and special occasions. NOW years later
column6: the main home base store is like any of the other stores and vending machines they have around the country. Extremely disappointing their main bakery has gone corporate with pre packaged slices and not many options as before. Many of the desserts there look old and taste old. author: Ms Suazo
text: 'I was so excited to visit Carlos bakery on a Saturday late afternoon and boy was I disappointed with the experience 😔. Having the reputation they have
column5: I expected the employees to be more welcoming and not feel like they just want people in and out. There were no lines
column6: walked right in. I was hoping to meet Maddalena and Mauro because they genuinely seem like the nicest and humble people but no family
column7: I guess it’s the weekend or they are all in Lackawanna lol.\n\nI would’ve wanted to have more options but unfortunately there weren’t. Can you believe an Italian bakery but no tiramisu 😱😱😱😱😱! I decided to buy the famous lobster tail
column8: crumb cake and a slice of chocolate cake and chocolate chip cookies. To each its own but I prefer my lobster tails with a fluffier filling and the lobster tail itself to be bigger. The chocolate cake smelled delicious and it was good but thankfully the crumb cake saved the experience because it is DELICIOUS!\n\nWe didn’t spend more than 5-10 mins in there which is great no wait time but it’s not the inviting and happy Carlos bakery I love to watch on tv. Hopefully
column9: if I decide to go again
column10: I can have a different experience. Crumb cake five stars

author: Laurence Cutrone
text:
"Staff was pleasent and helpful. Store was spotless. Everything as far as being a business goes was great. Except what they sell.

The baked goods are mediocre at best and they are considerably overpriced compared to other bakeries. It was $30 for 18/20 rainbow cookies and 2 chocolate chip cookies. The rainbow cookies tasted processed and the chocolate chip was overly salty. Also tried a slice of cake and the cream has that processed sugar taste. I was thoroughly let down with how mediocre the food was.

It's a great looking
column5: clean
column6: professional establishment. I just wish their main products were good."

author: Lori Edge
text: 'We took the kids on a road trip to experience the New York area. Long hours in the van but they were so excited to get out and experience places they have only seen on tv. We drove over to the bakery and could not wait to see the place. So much effort to drive that far
column5: get everyone out of the van and in the rain to only get to stand at the door and be turned away due to a lousy mask order. The irony of standing in the middle of diabetes friendly treats with a rude employee shoving a “salvific” paper in your face. What a let down. Weary of the lying narrative but refuse to give in for the mob mentality stupidity. We should be free to think and do for ourselves.'

author: Connie Xu
text: 'While this cake was priced extremely reasonably
column5: I will have to admit that the cake itself was a little underwhelming. Really
column6: the cake was moist but the frosting was just too thick. The frosting that covered the cake cracked as I was slicing the cake
column7: which could be because the knife wasn’t sharp enough but it wasn’t the greatest thing to look at. Perhaps it’s all the hype around this bakery that made my expectations unreasonably high and overall
column8: I don’t regret my purchase! My mother loved the cake and the cake survived the one hour car ride home. Now let me tell you… this cake may seem small
column9: but my little family of four ate just over a quarter of the cake in one sitting. We couldn’t make it through the rest! Overall
column10: I would say buy the cake for occasions if you are in the area… if not
column11: I’m not sure how much shipping a cake would cost
column12: but it might be worth it to look at bakeries closer to you. The sole reason I didn’t give Carlo’s 5 stars is because I think the frosting is too sweet and too much
column13: but that’s of course a personal preference.'

author: Jason Silva
text: "I'm a big fan of the Cake Boss
column5: and Buddy is a big reason for my home baking. But I'm also born and raised from Brooklyn and have been exposed to Italian bakeries my whole life. I was surprisingly underwhelmed by the pastries at Carlo's Bakery. I tried the Lobster Roll
column6: which I was inspired to try when he made them on Buddy vs Duff
column7: but they were half size of other bakeries (at the same price) and tasted average. I had a similar experience with flavor when trying the cannoli and Cheesecake. I was also surprised by the lack of other pastries common at an Italian Bakery
column8: but I can only assume that it's a business decision to only carry what sells in the neighborhood. So if you live in the neighborhood or are visiting Hoboken
column9: Carlo's Bakery is a good place to quench that sweet tooth. But as for a must go spot I recommend other places in Brooklyn and Queens first."

author: Latif Kehar
text: "The menu consists of many traditional Italian desserts including their famous cannolis and “lobster tails” (a soft pastry filled with cream). Of course
column5: there are also cakes (whole or slices) on offer as well as cookies
column6: cupcakes and croissants. The prices are quite steep – We paid $6.25 for a cannoli and $6.25 for a lobster tail (this adds up quickly when there are two of you) – But we were given a free “Carlo's Bakery” apron when our order reached more than $62. We did pick up a 1 lb box of “Italian Butter Cookie” ($21.95)
column7: which looked quite good
column8: for a gift."
